subject: Reporting more then 1 failed assertion per test
msgSnippet: thanks for your help...I probably should have elaborated on the scenario a bit more... I ll know for next time. My problem is that I am probably trying to use
messageBody:
thanks for your help...I probably should have elaborated on the scenario
a bit more... I'll know for next time.

My problem is that I am probably trying to use JUnit in a way that it
wasn't intended to be used. I am not actually testing that a single
method functions correctly ( i have seperate tests for this that work
fine), I am testing that a method setAttribute() can set a value of an
attribute in a database and I then assert that a method getAttribute()
returns me the expected value.

I am hoping to test that all the attributes in the database can be set
and that someone hasn't unwittingly changed a particular attribute to
read-only. It would seem to be overkill to have a test method for each
of the hundreds of attributes. So i currently do the following,

- add a failure to a testResult
- fail if the testResult failureCount > 0
- print out all the failures

If anyone can help me with a better approach I would be grateful.

thanx again
